The State of the Industry: Insights from VentureSail
We caught up with VentureSail Director, Jo Downie, on the challenges of the Charter sector and how the industry is doing.
Author
:
Sailing Today
Published Date:
18 September 2025
SHARE THIS ARTICLE
Jo Downie (left)  |  Photo credit: VentureSail
Tell us a bit about VentureSail. What does the company do, and how did it get started?
VentureSail
offers a variety of fully crewed sailing experiences across a fleet of unique and interesting vessels, run by passionate seafarers worldwide. Most of our boats are owner-operated, providing guests with access to first-hand knowledge of a location and the opportunity to learn from very experienced crews. Guests can join in without ever having set foot on a boat before.
The agency was started in 2018 after working with Nikki Alford, skipper and owner of
historic ship Bessie Ellen
. We identified a need to support vessels and operators like hers at sea, who struggle to respond to emails or navigate modern-day marketing for their bookings. So we created a bespoke agency that represented this unique type of charter holiday. We built the website and booking engine from scratch, enabling us to tailor our processes and marketing to each boat’s unique needs.
What is your role within VentureSail, and how did you get started in the role? Have you always been into sailing?
I’m Cornish, so the sea has always played a big part in my life, but I came to sailing later in life when water skiing was no longer good for me. I’m the managing director and founder of the company with a strong background in marketing and tech. I closed my marketing agency during COVID to focus on this business full-time, with the goal of expanding the charter holiday sector. Although this is a fairly niche business, we have now expanded into European markets and work with operators from all over the world. We are still based in Cornwall, with an all-female team, but have a global vision, we sail with all our boats and have a great work-life balance by the sea.
What are the challenges and rewards of working in this sector of the marine industry?
Of course, when your business is determined by weather, there are naturally challenges, with fast-paced decisions that have to be made to ensure guests have the best experience. The rewards are immeasurable, though. A particular reward for us is having so many first-time customers who get completely hooked on sailing and have continued on to cross the Atlantic. We are also proud that so many experienced sailors choose to join us around the world. Whether it’s guests who have previously owned their own boat, but now want the headaches of route planning and paperwork taken care of, or guests who did their day skipper 25 years ago, once onboard everyone’s skill level comes together to work as a team - an experience that you can only get whilst sailing!
Are there any routes or itineraries that are especially popular with clients at present, or any you are looking to promote?
We have seen growth in our mile-builder trips, which offer more days and nights at sea to gain experience. From hopping over the English Channel to sailing the length of the UK and crossing the Atlantic, time away from it all with no digital connection is becoming more popular. For some, it’s an alternative to travelling to different locations without flying. Sustainable slow travel wasn’t a major consideration five years ago, but it has become a factor in people’s decision-making when planning a holiday. Solo travellers now make up 40% of our customer base, with equal proportions of men and women joining our boats alone. There is definitely a specific type of customer that joins our trips, so you are bound to meet like-minded people.
How do you see the state of the industry at present? Are there reasons to be cheerful?
There is an increasing amount of legislation changes from our own MCA and other countries’ marine authorities. Sailing in some areas of Europe and the world has become a paperwork nightmare for charter sector operators, and it’s getting increasingly difficult for the historic fleet to make ends meet with so many cost increases, which is worrying for their futures. But we see nothing but growth in our little corner of the market, as people want to escape the ordinary and use their well-earned time off to try something completely different that’s perhaps out of their comfort zone.

Following the journeys of the most travelled superyachts in 2025
8 January 2026 •
by Gabrielle Lazaridis
Driven by a keen desire to see the world, the superyacht fleet continues to travel near and far in search of exotic islands, intimate wildlife encounters or even just a slice of "la dolce vita" in the summertime. According to
BOATPro
's Global Fleet Tracker, more than 6,700 superyachts racked up a cumulative 20,963,247 nautical miles during 2025, showing an increase in traffic from last year's total distance of 19,894,029 nautical miles.
Wondering which ones went the furthest? BOATPro takes an inside look at what the top 10 most travelled yachts got up to over the past year...

DOM155: Baglietto unveils 46m flagship DOM line yacht model
13 January 2026
• Written by Emily Dawkins
Italian yard
Baglietto
has unveiled a new flagship addition to its successful DOM superyacht line: the DOM155. The first 46.4-metre unit will be available in early 2029.
The new model comes as an evolution of the popular 40.9-metre DOM133 line, which has 12 units sold, and the 34.5-metre DOM115 line, which has four new build orders to date. Characterised by a sub-500GT volume, the new displacement motor yacht follows the previous models' Roman domus concept of "warm, welcoming and refined", now expanded with larger volumes and "enhanced liveability".
Italian designer and long-time Baglietto collaborator
Stefano Vafiadis
has returned for the design of the DOM155. Vafiadis describes the design as “clean and sculptural," while “never excessive, yet balanced and aggressive at the same time, featuring longitudinal cuts and taut volumes inspired by automotive design.”
Taking inspiration from the DOM133, the DOM155 features generous volumes, floor-to-ceiling glazing and a "seamless dialogue" between interior and exterior spaces.
The main focus of the model is found in the stern. Dedicated to relaxation and well-being, the space features a central panoramic infinity pool with steps on either side leading to the aft cockpit. This space can be configured with a spa and gym overlooking the sea, thanks to a fold-down port-side shell door, or as an additional tender garage if desired.
The aft swimming platform also features a large transformer for swimming and easy dock access
Inside, living areas comprise a main deck saloon with a dining table for ten guests aft, and an upper deck saloon which opens on three sides for panoramic views. Also on the main deck is the owner's suite, which spans the yacht's full beam and is fitted with a walk-in closet, a master bedroom with a California king-size bed and a spacious his-and-hers en suite with a "walk-through" shower.
Four en suite guest cabins are located on the lower deck, forward of which is accommodation for a crew of eight in addition to a crew mess and laundry area. An additional guest cabin can also be incorporated on the upper deck if desired.
Other lounge spaces on board can be found forward of the wheelhouse (near a technical area housing a tender and jet ski) and a 130-square-metre sundeck fitted with sunbathing areas, a "conversation lounge" and an infinity pool with an integrated bar.
4 images
The latest DOM 133 yacht
Sui Generis
was launched in July 2025
In keeping with the DOM133, aluminium has been chosen as the construction material for the DOM155, allowing for greater customisation alongside improved performance and a shallow draught. As such, the project is particularly appealing to the American market, of which the La Spezia–based shipyard notes as one of its most important markets.
“The DOM155 is the result of listening carefully to our clients and, more broadly, to the market, which has enthusiastically welcomed both the 35- and 41-metre models but has repeatedly expressed interest in larger dimensions,” explained Baglietto’s chief commercial officer, Fabio Ermetto.
He continued: “This project, developed together with architect Stefano Vafiadis, brings together many of the improvement suggestions and experiences shared by our owners over the years, resulting in a yacht with high levels of customisation, comfort, and liveability that we are confident will fit perfectly into the sub-500 GT yacht segment.”
The DOM155 will be powered by twin CAT C32 engines, capable of reaching a 16-knot maximum speed.
According to
BOATPro
, Baglietto currently has 18 yachts on order or under construction, including three 60-metre T60 yacht models.

Oyster Yachts reports improved FY25 results amid turnaround plan
8 January 2026 •
by Gabrielle Lazaridis
Oyster Yachts
is reporting noticeable improvements in its financial performance for the fiscal year (FY) ended 31 March 2025.
Within the past 12 months, the British shipyard saw a moderate increase in revenue, from £61.7 million in FY24 to £65.6 million, along with a 158 per cent surge in gross profit, which reached £10 million in FY25. The yard's gross profit margin increased from six per cent to 15 per cent during the same period.

First 36m Sirena Yachts flagship model on track for 2026 delivery
13 January 2026
• Written by Emily Dawkins
Turkish shipyard
Sirena Yachts
has announced that construction is steadily progressing on its first 36-metre Sirena 118 superyacht model. Major technical and interior milestones have now been completed and the superyacht is on track for her scheduled 2026 delivery.
According to the shipyard, works are now progressing on all plumbing, piping and technical installations alongside the production of teak decking and paint preparation. The new build will then undergo engine installation, paint completion and interior joinery ahead of her launch, sea trials and handover this year.
The model – penned by Sirena’s in-house design team – was first unveiled at the 2024
Monaco Yacht Show
as the largest in the shipyard’s composite line, built entirely in GRP with a sub-300GT volume and a flexible tri-deck layout.
7 images
Dutch designer
Cor D. Rover
is the brain behind the model's customisable interior design, which is said by the yard to be "contemporary-styled" and "highly elegant". Rover has used an "understated yet elegant" colour scheme, wood veneer applications and integrated soft lighting to create a sophisticated yet inviting ambience.
Cream upholstery, light wood tones and bronze accents characterise the decor - also chosen to help accentuate the spaces’ natural light, which, according to the yard, evolves from day to night with the glow from the rising to the setting sun.
Accommodation is for up to 12 guests and seven crew on board, with the guest accommodation comprising a VIP suite and four guest cabins on the lower deck. The shipyard has dedicated significant attention to the owner's area, which is located forward on the main deck and can extend across two decks in a "loft" option. A spiral staircase connects to a private relaxation space on the lower deck, which features a fold-down balcony.
There are plenty of social areas across the model's design, including an informal dining and lounging area on the main deck aft, outfitted with curvaceous contemporary furniture and curated fittings, while further dining and a wet bar can be found on the upper deck. Meanwhile, a Jacuzzi sits in the yacht's bow, flanked by sunpads and loungers.
With naval architecture by respected Argentinian naval architect
Germán Frers
, a fast displacement hull will give her a top speed of 16 knots, propelled by twin MAN V12 3,100hp engines. With a more powerful 3,800hp package, she will deliver a top speed of 21 knots.
“As the first Sirena 118 continues to take shape, we are proud to see the design vision materialising across every area of the build,” shared Sirena Yachts CEO, Çağin Genc. “The craftsmanship of our team, together with our long-standing partners such as Cor D. Rover and Germán Frers, is bringing this new flagship to life in a way that truly reflects the spirit of Sirena.”
The Turkish yard is also working towards the completion of its flagship yacht – created in collaboration with
Luca Vallebona
and
Hot Lab
– which is currently under construction in Yalova, Turkey, with delivery also scheduled for 2026.

Saudi Red Sea Authority launches official guide for coastal tourism
7 January 2026 •
by Gabrielle Lazaridis
The Saudi Red Sea Authority (SRSA) has released the Introductory Guide to Coastal Tourism Activities, marking a "first of its kind" digital gateway to help grow the sector.
The guide streamlines all relevant information, regulations and procedures into a single, centralised electronic reference for tourists, investors and practitioners. It has been designed to shorten processing timelines and transform the information-seeking journey into a smooth, reliable and fully integrated digital experience. The guide also includes a comprehensive FAQ section, along with clear, advisory-based guidance outlining permitted and prohibited practices.
The first series of the guide is dedicated to yachting activities, offering a clear and practical end-to-end pathway for a yacht’s journey from arrival to departure. This includes procedures, documentation, licenses and permits, mechanisms for identifying and confirming the port of entry (port/marina) through a licensed agent, as well as directories of approved service providers (maritime tourism agents, yacht charter companies and marinas). It also includes safety and environmental sustainability guidelines, alongside periodic updates of regulatory requirements.
AMAALA Triple Bay
"The significance of the guide stems from its role as a foundational enabler for the coastal tourism activities sector, one of the key drivers of tourism growth," the SRSA stated. "Its launch is the result of intensive coordination efforts led by the Authority in collaboration with relevant entities to ensure role integration, foster an attractive tourism and investment environment, support the sector’s accelerating growth and align with the objectives of Saudi Vision 2030."
The announcement forms part of a broader effort to enhance yachting activity within Saudi Arabia and the Red Sea.
BOATPro
recently spoke with the CEO of the Saudi Tourism Authority (STA) to learn more about the country’s bold plans for transforming the yachting landscape and the future of tourism in the region.

Sea Talk
TECHNOLOGIES DE CONNEXION
POUR L’INDUSTRIE SOUS-MARINE
ANTÉCÉDENTS ÉPROUVÉS
DE LIVRAISON DANS
LES DÉLAIS AVEC ZÉRO DÉFAUTS
Sea Talk Systems est le fournisseur indépendant agréé de kits UJ et UQJ, équipements et kits d’outils aux membres du Consortium UJ
Sea Talk Systems est une équipe très soudée de professionnels dont la plupart sont forts de plusieurs décennies d'expérience de la fourniture de kits et pièces destinés à l’industrie des câbles sous-marins.
Ils comprennent l’importance d’une fiabilité totale des pièces, kits et équipements, et connaissent les coûts énormes des défaillances. C’est pourquoi ils utilisent des processus stricts pour éliminer le risque de défaillances, et leurs excellents résultats en disent long sur le travail attentif de toute l’équipe.
La formation est l’un des pilliers de l’entreprise et STS s’assure continuellement que son équipe utilise les techniques les plus précises et les meilleurs équipements. Tous les membres de l’équipe sont polyvalents et cette flexibilité leur permet de diriger leurs efforts vers la tâche à réaliser afin de respecter les délais des commandes.
L’équipe de gestion a été formée pour savoir comment réaliser tous les processus nécessaires. Elle possède ainsi les informations nécessaires pour apporter des améliorations tant au niveau de la fiabilité qu’à celui de l’efficacité, tout en sachant identifier les éventuels risques à atténuer. C’est grâce à cette compréhension extrêmement détaillée de tous les aspects de l’entreprise que l’équipe réussit à maintenir ses antécédents de fiabilité à 100 % et de livraison dans les délais.
Contrôle Qualité
Contrôle Qualité
Kits UJ & UQJ
Kits UJ & UQJ
Contact
Contact
STS travaille avec un modèle commercial d’inspection intégrale qu’il a hérité quand l’activité a été transférée de Cable & Wireless Marine à STS. Le maintien de ce modèle commercial continue à garantir des kits et pièces de qualité et sans défauts dans cette industrie où la qualité est cruciale.
Dans ce secteur, une seule défaillance peut entraîner des pertes de revenus de centaines de milliers par jour si le système ne fonctionne pas. Sans mentionner le coût de la redirection du trafic, la location d’urgence de navires câbliers, la mise en place du personnel de jonctionnement, l’atteinte à votre réputation et à la confiance des clients.
Les raisons principales de la défaillance des systèmes sont généralement les bateaux de pêche, les ancres des navires, les séismes, les tsunamis et les courants de marée. STS est fier de garantir que les réparations ou nouveaux kits nécessaires sont fournis dans les délais, avec zéro défaut et aptes à l’utilisation.
STS occupe une installation ultra-moderne construite spécialement et dotée des équipements et contrôles de processus les plus récents.

A proven track

time with zero defects
SEA TALK SYSTEMS ARE THE INDEPENDENT APPROVED SUPPLIER OF UJ AND UQJ KITS, EQUIPMENT AND TOOL KITS TO THE UJ CONSORTIUM MEMBERS
Sea Talk Systems are a close knit team of professionals, most with decades of experience in the supply of kits and piece parts for the submarine cable industry.
They understand the importance of 100% reliable piece parts, kits and equipment, as well as the enormous costs of failure. This is why they operate strict processes to eliminate the risk of failures, and their track record stands as testament to the careful work of the entire team.
Training is at the core of the business, STS make sure their team is using the most accurate techniques and the best equipment. All of their team are multi-skilled; this flexibility allows them to direct their efforts to wherever it is needed to fulfil their orders on time.
The management team are trained in how to undertake all of their processes. This gives them the insight to make improvements to both reliability and efficiency as well as spotting possible risks to mitigate. Understanding every aspect of the business in intimate detail is key to maintaining their track record of 100% reliability, delivered on time.
Quality Control
Quality Control
UJ & UQJ Kits
UJ & UQJ Kits
Contact
Contact
STS operate using a 100% inspection business model, which they inherited when the business was transferred from Cable & Wireless Marine to STS. Maintaining this business model continues to ensure quality and defect free kits and piece parts in this quality critical industry.
A single failure in this industry can result in the loss of hundreds of thousands in lost revenue per day if your system is down. Not to mention the cost of re-routing traffic, the emergency hire of cable ships, jointing personnel, damage to your reputation and customers’ confidence.
Typically the main reasons for system failures can be fishing boats, ship anchors, earthquakes, tsunamis and tidal waters. STS are proud to guarantee that when repairs, or new kits are necessary, they will be supplied on time with zero defects and fit for purpose.
STS operate from a state of the art, purpose built facility, using the latest equipment and process controls.

Quality Control Services
100% inspection of piece
parts, kits and equipment
SEA TALK SYSTEMS ARE THE INDEPENDENT APPROVED SUPPLIER OF UJ AND UQJ KITS, EQUIPMENT AND TOOL KITS TO THE UJ CONSORTIUM MEMBERS
S
ea
T
alk
S
ystems have a wealth of experience and proven track record for providing quality controlled kits to the UJ Consortium for over 28 years.
Sea Talk Systems business model is 100% inspection of piece parts, kits and equipment.
STS maintain a flexible approach to meeting all their customers’ requirements but will not compromise on quality. They focus on avoiding failure and its consequences.
Fast and accurate
Fast and accurate
Dimensional checking needs to be both fast and accurate. STS has invested in the latest co-ordinate measuring machines to maintain their confidence in the conformance of components to specification. All their inspection equipment is located in dedicated temperature controlled environments to aid in achieving these high standards.
Certified Quality
Certified Quality
STS holds
ISO 9001:2015 QUALITY CERTIFICATION
and also require their manufacturing subcontractors to maintain this accreditation as a minimum. Rigorous internal and external audits are carried out and continuously monitored and improved.
The established processes and practices at STS that have been developed within a business environment, demand a formal quality assurance regime and full traceability of activities, processes and materials.
Sourcing and procurement
Sourcing and procurement
Sea Talk’s role is to provide a sourcing and procurement facility to supply parts which range from small to high precision mechanical piece parts to equipment, at competitive costs and to the highest quality.
Every manufactured part, without exception, is subjected to a 100% inspection process, which includes dimensional checks, hardness tests, threads and finish, to drawing requirements. All mechanical equipment such as moulds and hydraulic presses are assembled and verified prior to despatch. Jointing equipment is fully assembled and checked prior to despatch.
Supplier management
Supplier management
A list of approved suppliers is maintained from information obtained from supplier questionnaires, historic data and delivery / quality performance. New suppliers are only added following successful audit assessment and prove out of manufacturing processes.
STS electronically store all inspection and manufacturing records to ensure there is full traceability of kits and piece parts for 25 years. In the event of system fault, without full traceability, it will be impossible to identify the root cause and take corrective action.

Cookies Policy
In this policy, unless it is obvious that they have some other meaning, the words "we", "our" and "us" refers to
www.seatalk.com
and its owner(s) Sea Talk Systems Ltd.
To contact the data protection officer you should email
[email protected]
.
This Cookie Policy outlines to you what “cookies” are, why they are used, how we use them and how you can disable them in your browser if desired. Please be aware that if you disable cookies in your browser there may be areas and aspects of our website which will not work as expected.
This cookie policy should be read alongside our
privacy policy
so you fully understand how and why we use cookies and the additional information we may collect from you. If you do not fully understand and agree with our cookie and privacy policies you must cease use of our website immediately.
If you require any clarification about our cookie policy please email the data protection officer.
Cookies – what are they?
Cookies are small text files which are stored on your computer’s hard drive. They can be used by websites to track the user, remember preferences, allow the user to login to secure areas of websites, store items in virtual shopping baskets and a whole host of other tasks.
Why and how do we use Cookies?
We use cookies to allow for a greater browsing experience for our users. As illustrated above, Cookies can perform a number of very useful tasks which allow this. We may also use Cookies to help us better understand our users, how they use our website and their preferences to further enhance our website and business.
The Cookies we may use tend to fit into three main categories. A list of the three categories follows, along with an explanation of how and why we use Cookies in each instance.
Analytical Cookies
We may use anonymous analytics Cookies to track the number of users we have, the pages they visit, the duration of the visit, and a whole host of other useful information about how our users browse and engage our website.
Knowing this information allows us to understand our audience reach, audience demographics, the success our marketing campaigns, which areas of our website are most popular, and clearer picture of how to design and implement new changes to our website and business going forward. We are not able to identify you as an individual using analytics Cookies.
Functionality Cookies
We may use Cookies as a method of storing information which allows you to browse and use our website efficiently.
We may use such Cookies to perform tasks such as storing the items you have added to your online shopping cart, the information you filled into a form, your credentials to keep you logged into a secure area of the website, and to remember various other preferences.
Cookies from third-parties
The Web is an integrated place. Like most other websites, we may have third-party applications, programs, widgets and material on our website. Some of these may use Cookies to track various metrics, store preferences and customise their material to you.
An example of this which is widely used across the Web is social media buttons which allow users to like, share and comment about what they find on websites and may result in Cookies being set.
We cannot view or change third-party cookies, in the same way third-parties cannot view or change cookies set by us.
Turning Cookies off in your browser
If you decide to turn Cookies off in your browser you should be aware that certain areas and features of our website may not work as expected.
The majority of mainstream, up-to-date browsers allow you to disabled Cookies. Usually you can find where to do this by going to the options or preference tab within your browser. We offer some links below which may help you:
Firefox:
Enable and disable cookies that websites use to track your preferences
.
Internet Explorer:
Block or allow cookies
.
Google Chrome:
Enable or disable cookies
.
For users worried about Cookies used by advertisers, you can learn much more about them and how to disable them by visit the
Your Online Choices
.
You can email the data protection officer if you require any further information about Cookies.

UJ & UQJ Kits
Offering rapid turnaround
on UJ & UQJ kits and piece parts
SEA TALK SYSTEMS ARE THE INDEPENDENT APPROVED SUPPLIER OF UJ AND UQJ KITS, EQUIPMENT AND TOOL KITS TO THE UJ CONSORTIUM MEMBERS
STS support ALL kits for UJ, UQJ, Training Kits, Ferrule Kits, Tool Kits, Piece Parts and Equipment.
Since inception STS have inspected and supplied in excess of:
140,000 UJ/UQJ kits
5 million piece parts
2,500 tool kits
…On time, with zero defects and full traceability!
RAPID TURNAROUND
RAPID TURNAROUND
Sea Talk currently provides a standard 5 week lead time on most of all the high demand kits and standard products. This requires the holding of at least £2m worth of strategic stock and a range of individual piece parts that can be quickly converted into kits.
Working in partnership
Working in partnership
STS work in partnership with individual UJ Consortium Members by holding an agreed level of complete kits for call off when required.
Due to Sea Talks close working relationship with UJ Consortium Members, STS can offer a rapid turnaround on kits and piece parts to support emergency requirements.

SEA TALK SYSTEMS ARE THE INDEPENDENT APPROVED SUPPLIER OF UJ AND UQJ KITS, EQUIPMENT AND TOOL KITS TO THE UJ CONSORTIUM MEMBERS
Sea Talk Systems are a close knit team of professionals, most with decades of experience in the supply of kits and piece parts for the submarine cable industry.
They understand the importance of 100% reliable piece parts, kits and equipment, as well as the enormous costs of failure. This is why they operate strict processes to eliminate the risk of failures, and their track record stands as testament to the careful work of the entire team.
Training is at the core of the business, STS make sure their team is using the most accurate techniques and the best equipment. All of their team are multi-skilled; this flexibility allows them to direct their efforts to wherever it is needed to fulfil their orders on time.
The management team are trained in how to undertake all of their processes. This gives them the insight to make improvements to both reliability and efficiency as well as spotting possible risks to mitigate. Understanding every aspect of the business in intimate detail is key to maintaining their track record of 100% reliability, delivered on time.
Quality Control
Quality Control
UJ & UQJ Kits
UJ & UQJ Kits
Contact
Contact
STS operate using a 100% inspection business model, which they inherited when the business was transferred from Cable & Wireless Marine to STS. Maintaining this business model continues to ensure quality and defect free kits and piece parts in this quality critical industry.
A single failure in this industry can result in the loss of hundreds of thousands in lost revenue per day if your system is down. Not to mention the cost of re-routing traffic, the emergency hire of cable ships, jointing personnel, damage to your reputation and customers’ confidence.
Typically the main reasons for system failures can be fishing boats, ship anchors, earthquakes, tsunamis and tidal waters. STS are proud to guarantee that when repairs, or new kits are necessary, they will be supplied on time with zero defects and fit for purpose.
STS operate from a state of the art, purpose built facility, using the latest equipment and process controls.
Please watch their video
for a summarised view of Sea Talk’s operations.

Sea Talk
海底産業への
接続技術
不良ゼロで
納期通りの
納品実績
Sea Talk Systems は、UJ および UQJ キット、装置、ツールキットを UJ Consortiumメンバーに供給する独立認定サプライヤーです。
Sea Talk Systems は、海底ケーブル業界のキットおよびピースパーツの供給において数十年の経験を有する、密接に連携したチームメンバーで構成されるプロのチームです。
チームは100%信頼できるピースパーツ、キット、装置の重要性、そして膨大な故障コストを理解しています。これこそチームが故障リスクを排除するために厳格なプロセスを使用する理由であり、その実績はチーム全体の入念な作業の証となっています。
トレーニングはビジネスの中心に据えられており、STS はチームが最も正確な技術と最高の装置を使用していることを保証しています。チーム全員が複数のスキルを有し、この柔軟性により、注文を納期通りに納品する必要がある場合には、いつでもその業務に集中します。
経営陣はプロセスすべてを請け負う方法に関するトレーニングを受けています。このトレーニングにより、信頼性と効率性の両方において改善を行い、また潜在的なリスクを特定し、これを軽減するための識見を得ることができます。ビジネスのあらゆる局面をごく細部にいたるまで理解することは、100%の信頼性と納期通りの納品実績を維持する上で鍵となります。
品質管理
品質管理
UJ および UQJ キット
UJ および UQJ キット
お問い合わせ
お問い合わせ
STS は全数検査のビジネスモデルを使って事業を運営しています。これは事業を Cable & Wireless Marine から STS へ移管した際に引き継いだ慣行です。このビジネスモデルを維持することで、品質が非常に重要視される業界においてキットおよびピースパーツの品質と不良ゼロ確保が継続します。
この業界においては、システムダウンした場合、一つ故障が起きただけで、1日に何千万もの収益損となることがあります。もちろんトラフィックのリルーティングコスト、ケーブル敷設船の緊急レンタル、接続人員、評判や顧客信頼へのダメージは言うに及びません。
通常、システム故障の主な原因は漁船、船の錨、地震、津波、潮汐水です。STS は、修理や新しいキットが必要な場合、不良ゼロの目的に適合した製品やサービスを適時に供給することを保証することを誇りとしています。
STS は最新の装置やプロセス管理を用いて、最先端の専用施設で業務を行います。
Sea Talk の業務の概要をご説明したビデオをご覧ください
。

Privacy Policy
We are committed to safeguarding your privacy. This Policy explains how we collect and use personal information.
Please read the following carefully to understand our views and practices regarding your personal data and how we will treat it. By visiting
www.seatalk.com
you are accepting and consenting to the practices described in this policy.
For the purpose of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) (Regulation (EU) 2016/679) (GDPR), the data controller is Gary Ritchie.
To contact the data protection officer you should email
[email protected]
.
References to ‘we’, ‘our’ and ‘us’ within this Privacy Policy are to Sea Talk Systems Ltd.
The information we collect
This Policy applies to information you give us, through our website or by corresponding with us and information collected by us as you visit or interact with our website.
The data you provide may include:
Your name
Your email
Your contact details
The data we collect about you may include, but is not limited to:
Your IP address
Information about your browser and operating system
Information about your visit, this may include, but is not limited to, pages looked at, visit duration, errors encountered and interaction with the pages.
How we use your information
Any personal information we collect from this website is used in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679) and other applicable laws.
The information you provide allows us to do the following:
If you have made an enquiry then we will use your contact details to respond to your enquiry.
If you opted in to our newsletter then we send you our newsletter.
To provide you with the information, products and services that you request from us.
To notify you about changes to our services.
To protect keep our website safe and secure.
To improve our website and personalise it for you and your computer.
To provide an efficient service, certain functions such as hosting, storage and disaster recovery are provided by third parties.
To provide interactive features.
To measure the effectiveness of our advertising.
It is our policy to ensure that your personal data is not made accessible to unauthorised individuals. We have taken reasonable steps to protect both the digital and physical storage of data.
We strive to protect your personal information, we cannot ensure or warrant the security of any information you transmit to us and you do so at your own risk.
Your data may be kept if it is required for legal or accounting reasons.
Disclosure of your information
Analytics and search engines providers that assist us in the improvement and optimisation of our site may collect data about your IP and computer set up.
How long do we keep your data
We will not retain your personal information longer than necessary.
If legally required or if it is reasonably necessary to meet regulatory requirements, resolve disputes, prevent fraud and abuse, or enforce our Terms and Conditions, we may also retain some of your information for a limited period of time as required, even after it is no longer needed to provide services to you.
Cookies
Cookies are small pieces of information that are stored by your browser on your device's hard-drive. They are used to distinguish individual users, and help us improve our website.
We explain how we use cookies in our
cookies policy
.
Access to your personal information
If you would like to update or remove the data we have about you please submit a request to the data protection officer.
If you wish to unsubscribe from our email newsletter you should use the unsubscribe link at the bottom of the email. Should this not work please contact the data protection officer, using the details at the start of this policy.
If you would like to request access to the data we have about you please submit a request to the data protection officer.
If an access request is deemed by us to be unfounded or excessive we may charge a reasonable fee. If you request further copies of your data then we may charge for administrative fees.
Complaints
If you wish to make a complaint about our use of your data please contact the data protection officer.
Updates to this policy
This Policy was last updated in March 2018.
Any changes we make to this policy will be posted to this page.

Our Processes
SEA TALK SYSTEMS ARE THE INDEPENDENT APPROVED SUPPLIER OF UJ AND UQJ KITS, EQUIPMENT AND TOOL KITS TO THE UJ CONSORTIUM MEMBERS
Sea Talk Systems run all operations using a bespoke Process Control Plan with the end goal in mind. Their system guarantees that STS start right to finish right and provide their Customers with quality products on time with zero defects.
STS work in partnership with individual UJ Consortium Members by holding an agreed level of complete kits for call off when required.
Due to Sea Talk's close working relationship with it’s UJ Consortium Members, STS can offer a rapid turnaround on kits and piece parts to support emergency requirements.
Each kit is uniquely serialised to ensure full traceability from top level to each individual part within the kit. Each kit is given a double and independent check to ensure that all kits are supplied with zero defects.
